thread.title: North Broad's revived 'Met' to be latest addition to a crowded Philly music venue scene
thread.title_full: North Broad's revived 'Met' to be latest addition to a crowded Philly music venue scene

author: Dan DeLuca
title: North Broad's revived 'Met' to be latest addition to a crowded Philly music venue scene
text:
North Broad's revived 'Met' to be latest addition to a crowded Philly music venue scene Updated: March 29, 2017 â€” 4:51 PM EDT 179 Share 
"In the Mix" column in the Weekend section ventures further afield, into books, movies, TV, the Internet, graphic novels and anything you might call "popular culture." 
revival of the Metropolitan Opera Hous e, the giant white box that inhabits a city block on the corner of North Broad and Poplar Streets that was built in 1908 by impresario Oscar Hammerstein I, is good news for historical preservation advocates and the growth of nightlife in North Philadelphia. 
"right now, our focus is to make Live Nation happy." 
When it was built, the hulking structure was called the Philadelphia Opera House, and it served variously as a movie theater, church and home to boxing matches before going dark as a music venue in the 1980s. 
Live Nation's Festival Pier, which holds 6000, and the Mann Center in Fairmount Park, which holds up to 15000 but is quite comfortable for bands who draw three or four thousand under the amphitheatre roof. 
with Ted Nash of the Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra as headliner. Dan DeLuca
